name: "Supergirl" Season 2 Episode 10 Quiz / Test | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which season one villain returned for this episode?
questions.explanation:
Livewire.

	Livewire, or Lesley Willis, was a radio DJ on a CatCo. owned station before turning to a life of crime. She was struck by lighting while Supergirl was trying to save her helicopter in early season one. That turned her into Livewire. She returned to for an episode later in season one, and again for this episode in season 2.

questions.text: How was James injured early in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Shot.

	Winn was upset when he saw the bullet hole on James' left arm. James told him it was ok he was only "a little" shot. The two of them then debated on if it was time to tell Kara their secret or not.

questions.text: Who did Hank refuse to help save early in the episode?
questions.explanation:
M'gann.

	M'gann was a white martian that had disguised herself as a green martian earlier in the season. The DEO crew had arrested her and was holding her when she became ill. Hank was the only one who might be able to help her, using the martian mind melding abilities. Initially he refused because the white martians had destroyed his people. Eventually he agreed to help her.

questions.text: Did James tell Kara he was the Guardian?
questions.explanation:
No.

	He had told Winn he would tell her, but before he got the chance Livewire attacked. Her was injured during the fight with Livewire and Supergirl took his helmet off, revealing his identity to her.

questions.text: Who did Supergirl say the following line to? "If you don't stop, I'll stop you."
questions.explanation:
James.

	While Livewire was her nemesis, that exchange was said in James' office after they talked about him becoming a hero. He told her to go ahead and try to stop him.

questions.text: Who found Lesley Willis after she was kidnapped?
questions.explanation:
Winn.

	Winn told everyone in the DEO that he couldn't find her, then he called James and told him that he had found her. He wanted to know if James wanted to track her down and prove to Supergirl that he was a real hero. Mon-El overheard the conversation and followed them.

Mon-El.

	Mon-El busted into the warehouse that Livewire was held captive in and saved James from getting electrocuted by a pair of knock-off copies of her. When Livewire asked him who he was he said he was the "other Superman", in training.

questions.text: Supergirl allowed a villain to go free near the end of the episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After freeing Livewire from her captives, Livewire attacked one of the scientists goons and saved Supergirl. A few minutes later Livewire was attempting to kill the scientist, and agreed to let him live if Supergirl didn't arrest her. Supergirl said she couldn't promise Livewire would never go to jail, ut agreed not to chase her down right away if she didn't kill the scientist.

questions.text: What did Alex's girlfriend make her agree to try to eat?
questions.explanation:
Vegan icecream.

	They made a bet early in the episode about Kara getting into a jail cell using only her press credentials. Alex won and the girlfriend had to stay the night at her house. Later in the episode Maggie won another bet and Alex had to agree to eat vegan ice cream. She wasn't happy about it.

questions.text: Who professed feelings towards Kara near the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Mon-El.

	He was waiting outside of her apartment in the final scene. He told her she was right, referencing an earlier scene where she asked him if he "liked" her. He went on to say that he remembered kissing her when he was sick (several episodes earlier), and that he cared about her. She thanked him for being honest, but didn't say she reciprocated the feelings.
